This activity extracts a rich set of visual features based on the image content. Supported image formats JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP. Image size should be less than 4 MB.
This activity generates a description of an image in human readable language with complete sentences. Supported image formats JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP. Image size should be less than 4 MB.
This activity performs object detection on the specified image. Supported image formats JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP. Image size should be less than 4 MB.
This operation returns a bounding box around the most important area of the image. Supported image formats JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP. Image size should be less than 4 MB.
Fetches a read result for an existing Microsoft Vision operation ID.

This operation generates a thumbnail image with the user-specified width and height. By default, the service analyzes the image, identifies the region of interest (ROI), and generates smart cropping coordinates based on the ROI. Supported image formats JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP. Image size should be less than 4 MB.
Lists all records in Microsoft Vision.

Optical Character Recognition (OCR) detects text in an image and extracts the recognized characters into a machine-usable character stream. Supported image formats JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP. Image size should be less than 4 MB.

Activity optimized for text-heavy images and multi-page, mixed language, and mixed type (print – seven languages and handwritten – English only) documents. Supported image formats JPEG, PNG, BMP, PDF and TIFF. Image size should be less than 50 MB.
This activity generates a list of words, or tags, that are relevant to the content of the supplied image. Supported image formats JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP. Image size should be less than 4 MB.

Throws an exception previously caught in an exception handling block.
Retries the contained activities as long as the condition is not met or an error is thrown.
Executes a set of child activities according to a single, defined order.
Updates the value of an indicated asset, that is already available in Orchestrator, be it a global or a Per Robot asset.
Updates the value of an indicated credential asset, that is already available in Orchestrator, be it a global or a Per Robot asset.
Helps you create custom progress statuses for your In Progress transactions.
Sets the status of a transaction item to Failed or Successful.
Save a value to use in later activities. The saved value can be used as input to another activity.
Checks if Stop was triggered in UiPath Orchestrator.
Sorts a datatable by ascending or descending order, based on the values of a specified column.
Starts a job on Orchestrator and continue execution without waiting for the job to be finished.
Creates a new timer or restarts an existing one received as parameter
Stops or kills a job on Orchestrator.
Stop the timer previously started using the Start Timer Activity.
Executes the activities added in a single Case block out of multiple defined cases based on which case matches a specified expression.

Terminates the running workflow instance, raises the System.Activities.WorkflowApplication.Completed event in the host, and reports error information. Once the workflow is terminated, it cannot be resumed.
Gets the text to the left and right of the first occurrence of the indicated subtext.
Throws an exception.
Creates a scope with limited execution time. It throws a System.TimeoutException in case of timeout.
Contains activities to be executed by the workflow runtime in an exception handling block.
Updates the value of a specific item in a list. Add a Read list item activity after it to ensure you are using the updated value going forward.
Assigns the specified value into the indicated column of a DataTable row.
Uploads a local file to the Orchestrator storage, in a certain bucket and at a certain path
Detects a file download from any application and waits for the download to complete before any further processing of the file in the automation.
Waits for an item in the queue to be available so that you can process it (start the transaction) and sets its status to In Progress.
Executes contained activities while the condition is True
Displays the specified data or text in the Output panel.
Saves an input String into a file in the Orchestrator storage, in a certain bucket and at a certain path
Copies a text and pastes it in a text file replacing any existing data in the file.
Ensures the automated app is in a specific state, by verifying if a UI element exists or not. A set of user-defined actions are executed based on the detected state.
Checks if an element is enabled or disabled.
Used to check, uncheck, or toggle a checkbox.
Clicks a specified UI element.
Extracts tabular data from a specified web page or application.
Retrieves the value of a specified attribute of the indicated UI element.
Extracts the text from a specified UI element.
Returns the URL from the current browser.
Opens an URL in the current browser, either in a new tab or the current one.
Visually highlights a specified UI element by surrounding it in a box.
Hovers the mouse over a specified UI element.
Sends one or more keyboard shortcuts to a UI element.
Sends mouse scroll events to the specified UI element.
Allows basic navigation of the browser, like Go back, Go forward, Close, Refresh, Home.
Selects an item from a drop-down list.
Takes a screenshot of an application or UI element.
Enters text in a specified UI element, for example a text box.
Opens a web browser page to use in your automation.
Deserializes the Json string to a JObject object
Deserializes the Json array string to a JArray object
Deserializes a XML string to a XDocument object
Gets the attributes of a XML Node
Deserializes a XML into a list of nodes

Composes a request to an endpoint url, executes it and returns the response in a string format, saving the resource if specified. It has authentication capabilities allowing communication with secured endpoints

Lists all the records of an object in Zendesk.

List all the tickets in Zendesk.
Replace a group in Zendesk.

Search for group, user, ticket or organization.
Replaces a record in Zendesk.
Uploads a file to Zendesk.

Insert a record in Zoom
Invites a new meeting registrant to a meeting
Invokes a Zoom API method.

Schedules a one time meeting
